Justification: To confirm elevated glucose levels and assess for diabetes.
To evaluate average blood glucose levels over the past 2-3 months and help diagnose diabetes.
To assess how the body processes glucose and confirm diabetes diagnosis.
To check for glucose and ketones in the urine, which can indicate diabetes.
To evaluate insulin production and differentiate between type 1 and type 2 diabetes.
To check for autoimmune markers that can indicate type 1 diabetes.
To assess cholesterol levels, as diabetes can be associated with dyslipidemia.
To rule out thyroid dysfunction, which can be associated with diabetes.
